intro: Anthriscus aemula, commonly known as cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Anthriscus aemula is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
